text: It was never known why that statue had sprouted in the garden. The case was that one morning they met her, still in the hypocritical gesture of the statues, on a pedestal having been there all her life. They did inquiries, asked in ten leagues to the round. No one knew anything. Only the one who explains it all somehow thought that that must be a ghost, that he had turned his head or had done something forbidden by law and had become a stone statue. FIN
title: La estatua inesperada
author: Ramón Gómez de la Serna
